children.value: An organization asset represents an entity that Availity does business with. These include payers, clearinghouses, providers, and vendors. This endpoint allows clients to query collection of organizations which are associated to a logged in user.
Find a user's organization collection with a set of parameters. The request parameters act as filters on the collection.
The client must send at least one of the following:
Allows the client to retrieve multiple organizations by their ids. Accepts multiple
Allows the client to retrieve multiple organizations by their customer ids. Accepts multiple
Allows the client to retrieve organizations that the user is a part of. Accepts a single user id parameter.
Allows the client to retrieve organizations within the specified regions. Accepts multiple
Allows the client to retrieve organizations with the specified status codes. Accepts multiple status code parameters. Defaults to
Allows the client to retrieve organizations with the specified permission ids. Accepts multiple
Retrieve other info (number of licensed physicians/clinicians, specialty types, etc) for the matched organizations. Defaults to

An array of taxIds is returned for each organization, and will have the first result as the "primary" taxId. The type will be either "E" (EIN) or "S" (SSN). Additional taxIds will have the type "ALTTAX" as secondary or alternative taxIds.
For selected payers, organizations can be validated using two checks. Note that the words "validated" and "verified" are used indiscriminately in all aspects of this process.
Prompting the user for check information
Generally, your application workflow should be:
Get user inputs, including the organization they're using
On submit, interrupt submission and check the organization's validation status
If the organization status is not
, prompt the user for check information via the modal window
After the check information modal window is dismissed, loop back to
Allow submission, and on the back end, validate the organization again to guard against any request tampering

You can check the validation status of an organization by calling the Organization Validations endpoint. Validation is always performed in the context of an application, denoted by an application ID and a payer ID.
Note: If organization validation has not been enabled for a specific application ID / payer ID combination, the organization will always show as
The client must send all parameters
The application ID for which to validate the organization. Accepts a single application ID parameters.
The customer ID of the organization to validate. Accepts a single customer ID parameter.
The payer ID of the application for which to validate the organization. Accepts a single payer ID parameter.
- The organization has been locked, and will require manual intervention from Availity to unlock.
- The organization has not yet been verified.
